author: Travis
title: Live Coding Mentor Marketplace
description: Coding roadblocks inhibit or slow down blockchain project completion & learning. Docs can be daunting & unhelpful compared to live help.

assessments.note: This proposal directly targets the challenge by influencing the new developer experience with a marketplace for mentors

Very solid proposal, the deliverables can support and onboard many startup and promote cohesion within the Cardano community of developers and Entrepreneurs. I think is a great idea to have a one stop shop for the pirposes of mentoring, assisting and expanding the resources needed to launvh new Dapps/Defi projects in the network.

The proposal as a whole is clearly and well written. However i cannot give you 5 star because i'm unsure if it actually solves this perticular challenge. Apart from that the proposal is solid. Well done.

With ongoing projects that is already providing much of this material for free, I am not sure if there is a large enough market for this proposal. In the event that I am incorrect, the proposal does not lay out sufficient enough metrics to determine ROI

More clarity on how many members are in the team taking care of these tasks and plan. If it's only you Travis do you have the knowledge to build the whole project on your own or you need extra developers in the team. The only thing I would suggest is on the starting stage perhaps onboard a large pool of developers and individuals interested in getting mentorship and extract all the things that could help make it a smooth experience. As a UX designer Im sure you may have this already in mind.
You have relevant experience for the proposal + you have included testing/monitoring with beta tester for the whole part of your project.

The proposal has been sufficiently ideated, is clear with enough detail to fairly judge the proposal on its merits. As mentioned in the proposal itself, the lack of validation for the monetisation model raises a concern on how effective the proposal could be.

Perhaps a more favourable rating would be provided if a pilot study to validate the business model was conducted.

I think you got it all covered, its a solid project with reasonable funding per stage, the plan is interesting and the previous experience shows that you have what it takes to make it happen. This brings confidence in the delivery. Good luck is a good one!

As said in the first part, the only thing that i m not sure is if this is the right fund to address. There is just one thing that is unclear to me, is your app will have  fees on a minute/hour basis ? Maybe develop this part or make it clearer.

However apart from that, you have a very well and thought through proposal. Good job.

solution: A marketplace for students & founders to find mentors and/or pro coders to help them through issues, tasks, & train in live coding sessions
experience:
Travis Cook: UI/UX Designer, Front-end Dev, & Product Owner
Erfun Tavakoli: Fullstack Developer, React, Typescript, Functional Programming
